Class ec.meta.LocalWeakCell 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.meta.LocalWeakCell
public class LocalWeakCell
extends Object
implements WeakCell
A LocalWeakCell is the implementation of WeakCell for keeping a weak reference to an object in the same objectspace (e.g. same vat). Note that outside of a vat, this doesn't actually do the right thing--it's only because the EVM knows specially about this class that the "weak thing" can happen.

LocalWeakCell()
Create a WeakCell that initially doesn't point at anything.
LocalWeakCell(Object)
Create a WeakCell that initially points at the given target.

noticeLoss 
 public void noticeLoss()
This method is called when the GC determines that the target is garbage. It's called in the same thread that runs finalization; in a vat it is merely queued up on the vat's run queue.
